titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the USS Washtenaw County records

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

descgrp.accessrestrict: The collection is open for research use.

archdesc.bioghist: The USS Washtenaw County (LST 1166) was commissioned October 29, 1953. She was the most highly decorated ship of the Vietnam War, supporting the Mobile Riverine Forces, providing naval gunfire support, and acting as a transfer station for the wounded. At the end of the war, the Washtenaw County took part in "Operation Endsweep" to clear Haiphong Harbor of mines. She was officially deactivated on August 30, 1973. A memorial including the Washtenaw County's ship's bell, ribbon board, and other artifacts is displayed in the Washtenaw County Administration Building in Ann Arbor, Mich., and has been designated Washtenaw County Historic District No. 1.
archdesc.scopecontent: The collection consists of copies of the ship's deck logs, 1953-1973 with an index; copies of command history reports, 1951-1973, with service ribbons and commendations; copy of personnel diary, 1969; and copies of newspaper clippings. Also included are two pamphlets and a newspaper clipping of the rededication of the memorial in 2011, and a DVD containing a documentary on the construction of the memorial and its rededication, as well as raw footage of the rededication ceremony.
